                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha! fie, these filthy vices! It were as good</div>
                     <div class="line">To pardon him that hath from nature stolen</div>
                     <div class="line">A man already made, as to remit</div>
                     <div class="line">Their saucy sweetness that do coin heaven's image</div>
                     <div class="line">In stamps that are forbid: 'tis all as easy</div>
                     <div class="line">Falsely to take away a life true made</div>
                     <div class="line">As to put metal in restrained means</div>
                     <div class="line">To make a false one.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis set down so in heaven, but not in earth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">Say you so? then I shall pose you quickly.</div>
                     <div class="line">Which had you rather, that the most just law</div>
                     <div class="line">Now took your brother's life; or, to redeem him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Give up your body to such sweet uncleanness</div>
                     <div class="line">As she that he hath stain'd?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, believe this,</div>
                     <div class="line">I had rather give my body than my soul.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">I talk not of your soul: our compell'd sins</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand more for number than for accompt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">How say you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I'll not warrant that; for I can speak</div>
                     <div class="line">Against the thing I say. Answer to this:</div>
                     <div class="line">I, now the voice of the recorded law,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pronounce a sentence on your brother's life:</div>
                     <div class="line">Might there not be a charity in sin</div>
                     <div class="line">To save this brother's life?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Please you to do't,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll take it as a peril to my soul,</div>
                     <div class="line">It is no sin at all, but charity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">Pleased you to do't at peril of your soul,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were equal poise of sin and charity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">That I do beg his life, if it be sin,</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven let me bear it! you granting of my suit,</div>
                     <div class="line">If that be sin, I'll make it my morn prayer</div>
                     <div class="line">To have it added to the faults of mine,</div>
                     <div class="line">And nothing of your answer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, but hear me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Your sense pursues not mine: either you are ignorant,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or seem so craftily; and that's not good.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me be ignorant, and in nothing good,</div>
                     <div class="line">But graciously to know I am no better.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus wisdom wishes to appear most bright</div>
                     <div class="line">When it doth tax itself; as these black masks</div>
                     <div class="line">Proclaim an enshield beauty ten times louder</div>
                     <div class="line">Than beauty could, display'd. But mark me;</div>
                     <div class="line">To be received plain, I'll speak more gross:</div>
                     <div class="line">Your brother is to die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">So.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">And his offence is so, as it appears,</div>
                     <div class="line">Accountant to the law upon that pain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">True.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">Admit no other way to save his life,--</div>
                     <div class="line">As I subscribe not that, nor any other,</div>
                     <div class="line">But in the loss of question,--that you, his sister,</div>
                     <div class="line">Finding yourself desired of such a person,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose credit with the judge, or own great place,</div>
                     <div class="line">Could fetch your brother from the manacles</div>
                     <div class="line">Of the all-building law; and that there were</div>
                     <div class="line">No earthly mean to save him, but that either</div>
                     <div class="line">You must lay down the treasures of your body</div>
                     <div class="line">To this supposed, or else to let him suffer;</div>
                     <div class="line">What would you do?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">As much for my poor brother as myself:</div>
                     <div class="line">That is, were I under the terms of death,</div>
                     <div class="line">The impression of keen whips I'ld wear as rubies,</div>
                     <div class="line">And strip myself to death, as to a bed</div>
                     <div class="line">That longing have been sick for, ere I'ld yield</div>
                     <div class="line">My body up to shame.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">Then must your brother die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">And 'twere the cheaper way:</div>
                     <div class="line">Better it were a brother died at once,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than that a sister, by redeeming him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Should die for ever.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">Were not you then as cruel as the sentence</div>
                     <div class="line">That you have slander'd so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ignomy in ransom and free pardon</div>
                     <div class="line">Are of two houses: lawful mercy</div>
                     <div class="line">Is nothing kin to foul redemption.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">You seem'd of late to make the law a tyrant;</div>
                     <div class="line">And rather proved the sliding of your brother</div>
                     <div class="line">A merriment than a vice.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, pardon me, my lord; it oft falls out,</div>
                     <div class="line">To have what we would have, we speak not what we mean:</div>
                     <div class="line">I something do excuse the thing I hate,</div>
                     <div class="line">For his advantage that I dearly love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">We are all frail.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Else let my brother die,</div>
                     <div class="line">If not a feodary, but only he</div>
                     <div class="line">Owe and succeed thy weakness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, women are frail too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, as the glasses where they view themselves;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which are as easy broke as they make forms.</div>
                     <div class="line">Women! Help Heaven! men their creation mar</div>
                     <div class="line">In profiting by them. Nay, call us ten times frail;</div>
                     <div class="line">For we are soft as our complexions are,</div>
                     <div class="line">And credulous to false prints.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">I think it well:</div>
                     <div class="line">And from this testimony of your own sex,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Since I suppose we are made to be no stronger</div>
                     <div class="line">Than faults may shake our frames,--let me be bold;</div>
                     <div class="line">I do arrest your words. Be that you are,</div>
                     <div class="line">That is, a woman; if you be more, you're none;</div>
                     <div class="line">If you be one, as you are well express'd</div>
                     <div class="line">By all external warrants, show it now,</div>
                     <div class="line">By putting on the destined livery.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I have no tongue but one: gentle my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me entreat you speak the former language.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">Plainly conceive, I love you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">My brother did love Juliet,</div>
                     <div class="line">And you tell me that he shall die for it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall not, Isabel, if you give me love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I know your virtue hath a licence in't,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which seems a little fouler than it is,</div>
                     <div class="line">To pluck on others.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">Believe me, on mine honour,</div>
                     <div class="line">My words express my purpose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha! little honour to be much believed,</div>
                     <div class="line">And most pernicious purpose! Seeming, seeming!</div>
                     <div class="line">I will proclaim thee, Angelo; look for't:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sign me a present pardon for my brother,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or with an outstretch'd throat I'll tell the world aloud</div>
                     <div class="line">What man thou art.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">Who will believe thee, Isabel?</div>
                     <div class="line">My unsoil'd name, the austereness of my life,</div>
                     <div class="line">My vouch against you, and my place i' the state,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will so your accusation overweigh,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you shall stifle in your own report</div>
                     <div class="line">And smell of calumny. I have begun,</div>
                     <div class="line">And now I give my sensual race the rein:</div>
                     <div class="line">Fit thy consent to my sharp appetite;</div>
                     <div class="line">Lay by all nicety and prolixious blushes,</div>
                     <div class="line">That banish what they sue for; redeem thy brother</div>
                     <div class="line">By yielding up thy body to my will;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else he must not only die the death,</div>
                     <div class="line">But thy unkindness shall his death draw out</div>
                     <div class="line">To lingering sufferance. Answer me to-morrow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, by the affection that now guides me most,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll prove a tyrant to him. As for you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Say what you can, my false o'erweighs your true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">To whom should I complain? Did I tell this,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who would believe me? O perilous mouths,</div>
                     <div class="line">That bear in them one and the self-same tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">Either of condemnation or approof;</div>
                     <div class="line">Bidding the law make court'sy to their will:</div>
                     <div class="line">Hooking both right and wrong to the appetite,</div>
                     <div class="line">To follow as it draws! I'll to my brother:</div>
                     <div class="line">Though he hath fallen by prompture of the blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet hath he in him such a mind of honour.</div>
                     <div class="line">That, had he twenty heads to tender down</div>
                     <div class="line">On twenty bloody blocks, he'ld yield them up,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before his sister should her body stoop</div>
                     <div class="line">To such abhorr'd pollution.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, Isabel, live chaste, and, brother, die:</div>
                     <div class="line">More than our brother is our chastity.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll tell him yet of Angelo's request,</div>
                     <div class="line">And fit his mind to death, for his soul's rest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.5">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 3. ACT III</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  A room in the prison.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  The street before the prison.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  A room in the prison.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DUKE VINCENTIO disguised as before, CLAUDIO,
and Provost</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">So then you hope of pardon from Lord Angelo?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">The miserable have no other medicine</div>
                     <div class="line">But only hope:</div>
                     <div class="line">I've hope to live, and am prepared to die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Be absolute for death; either death or life</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall thereby be the sweeter. Reason thus with life:</div>
                     <div class="line">If I do lose thee, I do lose a thing</div>
                     <div class="line">That none but fools would keep: a breath thou art,</div>
                     <div class="line">Servile to all the skyey influences,</div>
                     <div class="line">That dost this habitation, where thou keep'st,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hourly afflict: merely, thou art death's fool;</div>
                     <div class="line">For him thou labour'st by thy flight to shun</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet runn'st toward him still. Thou art not noble;</div>
                     <div class="line">For all the accommodations that thou bear'st</div>
                     <div class="line">Are nursed by baseness. Thou'rt by no means valiant;</div>
                     <div class="line">For thou dost fear the soft and tender fork</div>
                     <div class="line">Of a poor worm. Thy best of rest is sleep,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that thou oft provokest; yet grossly fear'st</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy death, which is no more. Thou art not thyself;</div>
                     <div class="line">For thou exist'st on many a thousand grains</div>
                     <div class="line">That issue out of dust. Happy thou art not;</div>
                     <div class="line">For what thou hast not, still thou strivest to get,</div>
                     <div class="line">And what thou hast, forget'st. Thou art not certain;</div>
                     <div class="line">For thy complexion shifts to strange effects,</div>
                     <div class="line">After the moon. If thou art rich, thou'rt poor;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, like an ass whose back with ingots bows,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou bear's thy heavy riches but a journey,</div>
                     <div class="line">And death unloads thee. Friend hast thou none;</div>
                     <div class="line">For thine own bowels, which do call thee sire,</div>
                     <div class="line">The mere effusion of thy proper loins,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do curse the gout, serpigo, and the rheum,</div>
                     <div class="line">For ending thee no sooner. Thou hast nor youth nor age,</div>
                     <div class="line">But, as it were, an after-dinner's sleep,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dreaming on both; for all thy blessed youth</div>
                     <div class="line">Becomes as aged, and doth beg the alms</div>
                     <div class="line">Of palsied eld; and when thou art old and rich,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast neither heat, affection, limb, nor beauty,</div>
                     <div class="line">To make thy riches pleasant. What's yet in this</div>
                     <div class="line">That bears the name of life? Yet in this life</div>
                     <div class="line">Lie hid moe thousand deaths: yet death we fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">That makes these odds all even.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I humbly thank you.</div>
                     <div class="line">To sue to live, I find I seek to die;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, seeking death, find life: let it come on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  What, ho! Peace here; grace and good company!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Provost</div>
                     <div class="line">Who's there? come in: the wish deserves a welcome.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Dear sir, ere long I'll visit you again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Most holy sir, I thank you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ISABELLA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">My business is a word or two with Claudio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Provost</div>
                     <div class="line">And very welcome. Look, signior, here's your sister.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Provost, a word with you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Provost</div>
                     <div class="line">As many as you please.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring me to hear them speak, where I may be concealed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt DUKE VINCENTIO and Provost</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, sister, what's the comfort?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why,</div>
                     <div class="line">As all comforts are; most good, most good indeed.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Angelo, having affairs to heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">Intends you for his swift ambassador,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where you shall be an everlasting leiger:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore your best appointment make with speed;</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow you set on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Is there no remedy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">None, but such remedy as, to save a head,</div>
                     <div class="line">To cleave a heart in twain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">But is there any?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, brother, you may live:</div>
                     <div class="line">There is a devilish mercy in the judge,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you'll implore it, that will free your life,</div>
                     <div class="line">But fetter you till death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Perpetual durance?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, just; perpetual durance, a restraint,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though all the world's vastidity you had,</div>
                     <div class="line">To a determined scope.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">But in what nature?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">In such a one as, you consenting to't,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would bark your honour from that trunk you bear,</div>
                     <div class="line">And leave you naked.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me know the point.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, I do fear thee, Claudio; and I quake,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest thou a feverous life shouldst entertain,</div>
                     <div class="line">And six or seven winters more respect</div>
                     <div class="line">Than a perpetual honour. Darest thou die?</div>
                     <div class="line">The sense of death is most in apprehension;</div>
                     <div class="line">And the poor beetle, that we tread upon,</div>
                     <div class="line">In corporal sufferance finds a pang as great</div>
                     <div class="line">As when a giant dies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why give you me this shame?</div>
                     <div class="line">Think you I can a resolution fetch</div>
                     <div class="line">From flowery tenderness? If I must die,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will encounter darkness as a bride,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hug it in mine arms.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">There spake my brother; there my father's grave</div>
                     <div class="line">Did utter forth a voice. Yes, thou must die:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art too noble to conserve a life</div>
                     <div class="line">In base appliances. This outward-sainted deputy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose settled visage and deliberate word</div>
                     <div class="line">Nips youth i' the head and follies doth emmew</div>
                     <div class="line">As falcon doth the fowl, is yet a devil</div>
                     <div class="line">His filth within being cast, he would appear</div>
                     <div class="line">A pond as deep as hell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">The prenzie Angelo!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, 'tis the cunning livery of hell,</div>
                     <div class="line">The damned'st body to invest and cover</div>
                     <div class="line">In prenzie guards! Dost thou think, Claudio?</div>
                     <div class="line">If I would yield him my virginity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou mightst be freed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">O heavens! it cannot be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, he would give't thee, from this rank offence,</div>
                     <div class="line">So to offend him still. This night's the time</div>
                     <div class="line">That I should do what I abhor to name,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else thou diest to-morrow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt not do't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, were it but my life,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'ld throw it down for your deliverance</div>
                     <div class="line">As frankly as a pin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Thanks, dear Isabel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Be ready, Claudio, for your death tomorrow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes. Has he affections in him,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thus can make him bite the law by the nose,</div>
                     <div class="line">When he would force it? Sure, it is no sin,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or of the deadly seven, it is the least.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is the least?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">If it were damnable, he being so wise,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why would he for the momentary trick</div>
                     <div class="line">Be perdurably fined? O Isabel!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">What says my brother?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Death is a fearful thing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">And shamed life a hateful.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but to die, and go we know not where;</div>
                     <div class="line">To lie in cold obstruction and to rot;</div>
                     <div class="line">This sensible warm motion to become</div>
                     <div class="line">A kneaded clod; and the delighted spirit</div>
                     <div class="line">To bathe in fiery floods, or to reside</div>
                     <div class="line">In thrilling region of thick-ribbed ice;</div>
                     <div class="line">To be imprison'd in the viewless winds,</div>
                     <div class="line">And blown with restless violence round about</div>
                     <div class="line">The pendent world; or to be worse than worst</div>
                     <div class="line">Of those that lawless and incertain thought</div>
                     <div class="line">Imagine howling: 'tis too horrible!</div>
                     <div class="line">The weariest and most loathed worldly life</div>
                     <div class="line">That age, ache, penury and imprisonment</div>
                     <div class="line">Can lay on nature is a paradise</div>
                     <div class="line">To what we fear of death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, alas!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet sister, let me live:</div>
                     <div class="line">What sin you do to save a brother's life,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nature dispenses with the deed so far</div>
                     <div class="line">That it becomes a virtue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">O you beast!</div>
                     <div class="line">O faithless coward! O dishonest wretch!</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou be made a man out of my vice?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't not a kind of incest, to take life</div>
                     <div class="line">From thine own sister's shame? What should I think?</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven shield my mother play'd my father fair!</div>
                     <div class="line">For such a warped slip of wilderness</div>
                     <div class="line">Ne'er issued from his blood. Take my defiance!</div>
                     <div class="line">Die, perish! Might but my bending down</div>
                     <div class="line">Reprieve thee from thy fate, it should proceed:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll pray a thousand prayers for thy death,</div>
                     <div class="line">No word to save thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, hear me, Isabel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, fie, fie, fie!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy sin's not accidental, but a trade.</div>
                     <div class="line">Mercy to thee would prove itself a bawd:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis best thou diest quickly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">O hear me, Isabella!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter DUKE VINCENTIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Vouchsafe a word, young sister, but one word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">What is your will?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Might you dispense with your leisure, I would by and</div>
                     <div class="line">by have some speech with you: the satisfaction I</div>
                     <div class="line">would require is likewise your own benefit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I have no superfluous leisure; my stay must be</div>
                     <div class="line">stolen out of other affairs; but I will attend you awhile.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Walks apart</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Son, I have overheard what hath passed between you</div>
                     <div class="line">and your sister. Angelo had never the purpose to</div>
                     <div class="line">corrupt her; only he hath made an essay of her</div>
                     <div class="line">virtue to practise his judgment with the disposition</div>
                     <div class="line">of natures: she, having the truth of honour in her,</div>
                     <div class="line">hath made him that gracious denial which he is most</div>
                     <div class="line">glad to receive. I am confessor to Angelo, and I</div>
                     <div class="line">know this to be true; therefore prepare yourself to</div>
                     <div class="line">death: do not satisfy your resolution with hopes</div>
                     <div class="line">that are fallible: tomorrow you must die; go to</div>
                     <div class="line">your knees and make ready.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me ask my sister pardon. I am so out of love</div>
                     <div class="line">with life that I will sue to be rid of it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold you there: farewell.</div>
                     <p>Exit CLAUDIO</p>
                     <div class="line">Provost, a word with you!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter Provost</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Provost</div>
                     <div class="line">What's your will, father</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">That now you are come, you will be gone. Leave me</div>
                     <div class="line">awhile with the maid: my mind promises with my</div>
                     <div class="line">habit no loss shall touch her by my company.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Provost</div>
                     <div class="line">In good time.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit Provost. ISABELLA comes forward</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">The hand that hath made you fair hath made you good:</div>
                     <div class="line">the goodness that is cheap in beauty makes beauty</div>
                     <div class="line">brief in goodness; but grace, being the soul of</div>
                     <div class="line">your complexion, shall keep the body of it ever</div>
                     <div class="line">fair. The assault that Angelo hath made to you,</div>
                     <div class="line">fortune hath conveyed to my understanding; and, but</div>
                     <div class="line">that frailty hath examples for his falling, I should</div>
                     <div class="line">wonder at Angelo. How will you do to content this</div>
                     <div class="line">substitute, and to save your brother?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I am now going to resolve him: I had rather my</div>
                     <div class="line">brother die by the law than my son should be</div>
                     <div class="line">unlawfully born. But, O, how much is the good duke</div>
                     <div class="line">deceived in Angelo! If ever he return and I can</div>
                     <div class="line">speak to him, I will open my lips in vain, or</div>
                     <div class="line">discover his government.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">That shall not be much amiss: Yet, as the matter</div>
                     <div class="line">now stands, he will avoid your accusation; he made</div>
                     <div class="line">trial of you only. Therefore fasten your ear on my</div>
                     <div class="line">advisings: to the love I have in doing good a</div>
                     <div class="line">remedy presents itself. I do make myself believe</div>
                     <div class="line">that you may most uprighteously do a poor wronged</div>
                     <div class="line">lady a merited benefit; redeem your brother from</div>
                     <div class="line">the angry law; do no stain to your own gracious</div>
                     <div class="line">person; and much please the absent duke, if</div>
                     <div class="line">peradventure he shall ever return to have hearing of</div>
                     <div class="line">this business.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me hear you speak farther. I have spirit to do</div>
                     <div class="line">anything that appears not foul in the truth of my spirit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Virtue is bold, and goodness never fearful. Have</div>
                     <div class="line">you not heard speak of Mariana, the sister of</div>
                     <div class="line">Frederick the great soldier who miscarried at sea?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I have heard of the lady, and good words went with her name.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">She should this Angelo have married; was affianced</div>
                     <div class="line">to her by oath, and the nuptial appointed: between</div>
                     <div class="line">which time of the contract and limit of the</div>
                     <div class="line">solemnity, her brother Frederick was wrecked at sea,</div>
                     <div class="line">having in that perished vessel the dowry of his</div>
                     <div class="line">sister. But mark how heavily this befell to the</div>
                     <div class="line">poor gentlewoman: there she lost a noble and</div>
                     <div class="line">renowned brother, in his love toward her ever most</div>
                     <div class="line">kind and natural; with him, the portion and sinew of</div>
                     <div class="line">her fortune, her marriage-dowry; with both, her</div>
                     <div class="line">combinate husband, this well-seeming Angelo.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Can this be so? did Angelo so leave her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Left her in her tears, and dried not one of them</div>
                     <div class="line">with his comfort; swallowed his vows whole,</div>
                     <div class="line">pretending in her discoveries of dishonour: in few,</div>
                     <div class="line">bestowed her on her own lamentation, which she yet</div>
                     <div class="line">wears for his sake; and he, a marble to her tears,</div>
                     <div class="line">is washed with them, but relents not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">What a merit were it in death to take this poor maid</div>
                     <div class="line">from the world! What corruption in this life, that</div>
                     <div class="line">it will let this man live! But how out of this can she avail?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">It is a rupture that you may easily heal: and the</div>
                     <div class="line">cure of it not only saves your brother, but keeps</div>
                     <div class="line">you from dishonour in doing it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">Show me how, good father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">This forenamed maid hath yet in her the continuance</div>
                     <div class="line">of her first affection: his unjust unkindness, that</div>
                     <div class="line">in all reason should have quenched her love, hath,</div>
                     <div class="line">like an impediment in the current, made it more</div>
                     <div class="line">violent and unruly. Go you to Angelo; answer his</div>
                     <div class="line">requiring with a plausible obedience; agree with</div>
                     <div class="line">his demands to the point; only refer yourself to</div>
                     <div class="line">this advantage, first, that your stay with him may</div>
                     <div class="line">not be long; that the time may have all shadow and</div>
                     <div class="line">silence in it; and the place answer to convenience.</div>
                     <div class="line">This being granted in course,--and now follows</div>
                     <div class="line">all,--we shall advise this wronged maid to stead up</div>
                     <div class="line">your appointment, go in your place; if the encounter</div>
                     <div class="line">acknowledge itself hereafter, it may compel him to</div>
                     <div class="line">her recompense: and here, by this, is your brother</div>
                     <div class="line">saved, your honour untainted, the poor Mariana</div>
                     <div class="line">advantaged, and the corrupt deputy scaled. The maid</div>
                     <div class="line">will I frame and make fit for his attempt. If you</div>
                     <div class="line">think well to carry this as you may, the doubleness</div>
                     <div class="line">of the benefit defends the deceit from reproof.</div>
                     <div class="line">What think you of it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">The image of it gives me content already; and I</div>
                     <div class="line">trust it will grow to a most prosperous perfection.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">It lies much in your holding up. Haste you speedily</div>
                     <div class="line">to Angelo: if for this night he entreat you to his</div>
                     <div class="line">bed, give him promise of satisfaction. I will</div>
                     <div class="line">presently to Saint Luke's: there, at the moated</div>
                     <div class="line">grange, resides this dejected Mariana. At that</div>
                     <div class="line">place call upon me; and dispatch with Angelo, that</div>
                     <div class="line">it may be quickly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ISABELLA</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank you for this comfort. Fare you well, good father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt severally</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  The street before the prison.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter, on one side, DUKE VINCENTIO disguised as
before; on the other, ELBOW, and Officers with POMPEY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ELBOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, if there be no remedy for it, but that you will</div>
                     <div class="line">needs buy and sell men and women like beasts, we</div>
                     <div class="line">shall have all the world drink brown and white bastard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">O heavens! what stuff is here</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POMPEY</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twas never merry world since, of two usuries, the</div>
                     <div class="line">merriest was put down, and the worser allowed by</div>
                     <div class="line">order of law a furred gown to keep him warm; and</div>
                     <div class="line">furred with fox and lamb-skins too, to signify, that</div>
                     <div class="line">craft, being richer than innocency, stands for the facing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ELBOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Come your way, sir. 'Bless you, good father friar.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And you, good brother father. What offence hath</div>
                     <div class="line">this man made you, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ELBOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, sir, he hath offended the law: and, sir, we</div>
                     <div class="line">take him to be a thief too, sir; for we have found</div>
                     <div class="line">upon him, sir, a strange picklock, which we have</div>
                     <div class="line">sent to the deputy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, sirrah! a bawd, a wicked bawd!</div>
                     <div class="line">The evil that thou causest to be done,</div>
                     <div class="line">That is thy means to live. Do thou but think</div>
                     <div class="line">What 'tis to cram a maw or clothe a back</div>
                     <div class="line">From such a filthy vice: say to thyself,</div>
                     <div class="line">From their abominable and beastly touches</div>
                     <div class="line">I drink, I eat, array myself, and live.</div>
                     <div class="line">Canst thou believe thy living is a life,</div>
                     <div class="line">So stinkingly depending? Go mend, go mend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POMPEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, it does stink in some sort, sir; but yet,</div>
                     <div class="line">sir, I would prove--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, if the devil have given thee proofs for sin,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou wilt prove his. Take him to prison, officer:</div>
                     <div class="line">Correction and instruction must both work</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere this rude beast will profit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ELBOW</div>
                     <div class="line">He must before the deputy, sir; he has given him</div>
                     <div class="line">warning: the deputy cannot abide a whoremaster: if</div>
                     <div class="line">he be a whoremonger, and comes before him, he were</div>
                     <div class="line">as good go a mile on his errand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">That we were all, as some would seem to be,</div>
                     <div class="line">From our faults, as faults from seeming, free!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ELBOW</div>
                     <div class="line">His neck will come to your waist,--a cord, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POMPEY</div>
                     <div class="line">I spy comfort; I cry bail. Here's a gentleman and a</div>
                     <div class="line">friend of mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LUCIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, noble Pompey! What, at the wheels of</div>
                     <div class="line">Caesar? art thou led in triumph? What, is there</div>
                     <div class="line">none of Pygmalion's images, newly made woman, to be</div>
                     <div class="line">had now, for putting the hand in the pocket and</div>
                     <div class="line">extracting it clutch'd? What reply, ha? What</div>
                     <div class="line">sayest thou to this tune, matter and method? Is't</div>
                     <div class="line">not drowned i' the last rain, ha? What sayest</div>
                     <div class="line">thou, Trot? Is the world as it was, man? Which is</div>
                     <div class="line">the way? Is it sad, and few words? or how? The</div>
                     <div class="line">trick of it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Still thus, and thus; still worse!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">How doth my dear morsel, thy mistress? Procures she</div>
                     <div class="line">still, ha?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POMPEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Troth, sir, she hath eaten up all her beef, and she</div>
                     <div class="line">is herself in the tub.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, 'tis good; it is the right of it; it must be</div>
                     <div class="line">so: ever your fresh whore and your powdered bawd:</div>
                     <div class="line">an unshunned consequence; it must be so. Art going</div>
                     <div class="line">to prison, Pompey?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POMPEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, faith, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, 'tis not amiss, Pompey. Farewell: go, say I</div>
                     <div class="line">sent thee thither. For debt, Pompey? or how?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ELBOW</div>
                     <div class="line">For being a bawd, for being a bawd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, then, imprison him: if imprisonment be the</div>
                     <div class="line">due of a bawd, why, 'tis his right: bawd is he</div>
                     <div class="line">doubtless, and of antiquity too; bawd-born.</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, good Pompey. Commend me to the prison,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pompey: you will turn good husband now, Pompey; you</div>
                     <div class="line">will keep the house.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POMPEY</div>
                     <div class="line">I hope, sir, your good worship will be my bail.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">No, indeed, will I not, Pompey; it is not the wear.</div>
                     <div class="line">I will pray, Pompey, to increase your bondage: If</div>
                     <div class="line">you take it not patiently, why, your mettle is the</div>
                     <div class="line">more. Adieu, trusty Pompey. 'Bless you, friar.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Does Bridget paint still, Pompey, ha?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ELBOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Come your ways, sir; come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POMPEY</div>
                     <div class="line">You will not bail me, then, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, Pompey, nor now. What news abroad, friar?</div>
                     <div class="line">what news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ELBOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Come your ways, sir; come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to kennel, Pompey; go.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt ELBOW, POMPEY and Officers</p>
                     <div class="line">What news, friar, of the duke?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I know none. Can you tell me of any?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Some say he is with the Emperor of Russia; other</div>
                     <div class="line">some, he is in Rome: but where is he, think you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not where; but wheresoever, I wish him well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">It was a mad fantastical trick of him to steal from</div>
                     <div class="line">the state, and usurp the beggary he was never born</div>
                     <div class="line">to. Lord Angelo dukes it well in his absence; he</div>
                     <div class="line">puts transgression to 't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">He does well in 't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">A little more lenity to lechery would do no harm in</div>
                     <div class="line">him: something too crabbed that way, friar.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">It is too general a vice, and severity must cure it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, in good sooth, the vice is of a great kindred;</div>
                     <div class="line">it is well allied: but it is impossible to extirp</div>
                     <div class="line">it quite, friar, till eating and drinking be put</div>
                     <div class="line">down. They say this Angelo was not made by man and</div>
                     <div class="line">woman after this downright way of creation: is it</div>
                     <div class="line">true, think you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">How should he be made, then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Some report a sea-maid spawned him; some, that he</div>
                     <div class="line">was begot between two stock-fishes. But it is</div>
                     <div class="line">certain that when he makes water his urine is</div>
                     <div class="line">congealed ice; that I know to be true: and he is a</div>
                     <div class="line">motion generative; that's infallible.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">You are pleasant, sir, and speak apace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what a ruthless thing is this in him, for the</div>
                     <div class="line">rebellion of a codpiece to take away the life of a</div>
                     <div class="line">man! Would the duke that is absent have done this?</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere he would have hanged a man for the getting a</div>
                     <div class="line">hundred bastards, he would have paid for the nursing</div>
                     <div class="line">a thousand: he had some feeling of the sport: he</div>
                     <div class="line">knew the service, and that instructed him to mercy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I never heard the absent duke much detected for</div>
                     <div class="line">women; he was not inclined that way.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, sir, you are deceived.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not possible.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, not the duke? yes, your beggar of fifty; and</div>
                     <div class="line">his use was to put a ducat in her clack-dish: the</div>
                     <div class="line">duke had crotchets in him. He would be drunk too;</div>
                     <div class="line">that let me inform you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE VINCENTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">You do him wrong, surely.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I was an inward of his. A shy fellow was the</div>
                     <div class="line">duke: and I believe I know the cause of his</div>
                     <div class="line">withdrawing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
